column1: Many women at some time in their life experience sexual dysfunction.
Illnesses like cancer, bladder or bowel diseases, arthritis, and headaches may cause sexual problems.
- Some medicines: Medicine for blood pressure, depression, and chemotherapy can decrease your sex drive or make it hard to have an orgasm.

Call your health care provider If: - You are distressed by a problem with sex - Worried about your relationship - Have pain or other symptoms with sex Call your provider immediately if: - Intercourse is suddenly painful.
